book.title: The Catcher in the Rye
book.author: J.D. Salinger
book.description: A classic novel about the struggles of a teenage boy named Holden Caulfield in New York City.

book.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
book.author: Harper Lee
book.description: Set in the American South during the 1930s, this novel explores racial injustice and moral growth through the eyes of a young girl named Scout Finch.

book.author: George Orwell
book.description: A dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian society where the government controls every aspect of life, written by George Orwell.

book.title: The Great Gatsby
book.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
book.description: Set in the Roaring Twenties, this novel explores the American Dream and the complexities of love and wealth.

book.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
book.author: J.K. Rowling
book.description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, following the young wizard Harry as he discovers his magical abilities and embarks on a journey at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

book.title: The Hobbit
book.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book.description: A fantasy novel that follows Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who goes on an epic adventure to help a group of dwarves reclaim their homeland from a dragon.

book.title: Pride and Prejudice
book.author: Jane Austen
book.description: A classic novel exploring themes of love, class, and societal expectations in 19th-century England.

book.title: The Lord of the Rings
book.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book.description: A high fantasy trilogy following the quest to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth, written by J.R.R. Tolkien.

book.title: Brave New World
book.author: Aldous Huxley
book.description: A dystopian novel that explores a futuristic society where stability and conformity are prioritized over individual freedom.

book.title: The Odyssey
book.author: Homer
book.description: An ancient Greek epic poem attributed to Homer, telling the story of Odysseus and his adventures as he tries to return home after the Trojan War.
